headlands.name: 1st Headland
headlands.description: This is the headland closest to Morgan Bay village. Park on the L just after the concrete weir or follow the track through the first gate.

sectors.name: Bay Watch
sectors.description: Park just after the small bridge. Follow the fisherman path along the rocky beach. Bay Watch is the first low crag.

routes.name: Nein
routes.description: 7m R of chimney. Up easy line.

routes.name: Delta Force
routes.description: 4m R of chimney. Up good R trending crack.

routes.name: Windmill Windmill
routes.description: 3m R of chimney. Climb easy blocks.

routes.name: No Hassle
routes.description: 2m R of chimney. Climb up to small ledge and up short L facing corner.

routes.name: Eagle Fly Free
routes.description: Start just R of chimney. Move R onto ledge. Very arbitrary route.

routes.name: Time Marches
routes.description: Climb the chimney.

routes.name: Silicone Delight
routes.description: Climb crack 3m R of LH end of face.

routes.name: Revolution Now
routes.description: Climb the blocky R trending line that starts L and exits up L facing V-groove at top.

routes.name: Bambino
routes.description: Climb the line of short recesses immediately L of arête at LH end of face.

sectors.name: Angels Wall
sectors.description: Located on a wave cut platform along the rocky beach; climb only at low tide on calm days.

routes.name: Pixie
routes.description: 4m R of Cupid.

routes.name: Cupid
routes.description: Start at bottom RH corner of small face; climb the obvious L trending stepped line on excellent rock.

routes.name: On the Outside Looking In
routes.description: Stem op outside of chimney.

routes.name: Gung Ho
routes.description: Climb the pile of suspect blocks R of Water Baby.

routes.name: Water Baby
routes.description: Chimney 3m R of Where Angels Fear to Tread.

routes.name: Where Angels Fear To Tread
routes.description: Up crack in middle of face. Move 1m R into excellent vertical crack line.

routes.name: Even Demons Tremble
routes.description: Start as for Where Angels Fear to Tread. Continue straight up V-shaped recess to top.

routes.name: Roll over Rover
routes.description: 1m L of Where Angels Fear to Tread. Up to sloping block in recess. Step L onto face, then up.

routes.name: Fallen Angel
routes.description: 3m L of Where Angels Fear to Tread. Climb the easy obvious line.
routes.first_ascent: Bugs Spouse, Gavin Peckham & Anthony van Tonder

routes.name: Frigidaire Chimney
routes.description: Above the shelf just after the Angel Wall shelf. Reached by abseiling from the top of a grungy gully. (Route not yet located.)

sectors.name: Prometheus
sectors.description: On the landward side of the path between Bay Watch and Angels Wall.

routes.name: Mercury
routes.description: Climb the very short and easy line on boulder to the MB side, using rails and the arête. Cute!

routes.name: Icarus
routes.description: The line immediately R of Prometheus.

routes.name: Prometheus
routes.description: Start-up slight overhang, straight up face.

routes.name: Pegasus
routes.description: Climb the LH side of ‘Y’ shaped crack. Follow L trending cracks.

sectors.name: Lust or Love
sectors.description: Located on a grassy ledge above a cave over a dangerous chimney.

routes.name: Shagadelic
routes.description: 1m L of RH end of crag. Up and L.

routes.name: Please! Please Me!
routes.description: 2m L of Shagadelic. Up and trending R.

routes.name: Keeping Abreast
routes.description: 1m L of Tease Me! Please Me! Climb up to large ledge then up L facing corner.

routes.name: Tease Me, Please Me
routes.description: Start around the blunt arête to L of Keeping Abreast. Move R across a ledge to a L facing open book.

routes.name: One Up One Down
routes.description: Open book, chimney.

routes.name: Liquor is Quicker
routes.description: Start 3m L of One Up One Down. Up the short face on flaky jugs to a large ledge, then up short bulging face.

routes.name: Lady Star Light
routes.description: Climb the thin line between the open book and arête. Gain the ledge. Climb the last short face close to the arête.

routes.name: Candy’s Dandy
routes.description: Climb the open book.

routes.name: Give it to Me Baby
routes.description: Start 2m L of Candy’s Dandy. Climb the ramp; use the same exit as Candy’s Dandy.

routes.name: Self-Control
routes.description: Balance up the thin ramp above the Give It To Me Baby ramp. Top out just left of the exit.

routes.name: Climax
routes.description: Start-up same off width as Don't Believe Her. Rail R for 4m to reach under clings.

routes.name: Don't Believe Her
routes.description: Climb the off width on the far L. Traverse L near the top.

sectors.name: California Dreaming
sectors.description: Found along a steep passage near the First Headland, before Double Mouth.

routes.name: Apple Crumble
routes.description: Loose, blocky line to the right of So Few are so Free. Avoid!

routes.name: So Few are so Free
routes.description: Perfect crack in centre of seaward face.

routes.name: Stolen Thunder
routes.description: Climb the middle of the steeper slab immediately R of descent path.

routes.name: Nowhere Man
routes.description: Start-up rotten crack/ledges in the centre of the recess that separates the two smooth faces. Up for 8m till it begins to overhang. Step across to RH crack and finish up the RH crack.

routes.name: Penny Lane
routes.description: Start in big recess and climb the crack L of Nowhere Man. Use the R wall then the L halfway up. Break L and finish on a series of ledges.

routes.name: California Dreaming
routes.description: Double crack system on LH side; LH crack curves to R for about 4m before becoming a V-shaped groove. Start-up RH crack; 5m up move into LH crack and up the V-shaped groove.

routes.name: Sleeping with the Dog
routes.description: Climb the prominent fist crack at LH edge of LH wall.

routes.name: Systematic Selection
routes.description: 3m R of Storm Trooper of the Dark Ride, up an off width through a small roof, continue up to a belay where the grass starts.

routes.name: Paradise Road
routes.description: Prominent crack on the semi-free stander.

routes.name: Before The Seventh War
routes.description: 12m route. Open book 1m L of Storm Trooper of the Dark Ride; through roof & up crack on sea face.

routes.name: PraHAA
routes.description: 10m route. L trending diagonal crack. Loose and shit.

routes.name: Surfer Girl
routes.description: 9m route. Crack just L of L trending diagonal crack.

routes.name: Seal Wolf
routes.description: Up easy crack.

routes.name: Beach Bums
routes.description: 9m route. Easy slab steps.

routes.name: Beach Boys
routes.description: 9m route. Easy slab steps around the corner.

routes.name: Surfing USA
routes.description: 10m route. Crack system with large ‘V’ ledge just L of chimney on DM side of large ledge.

routes.name: No Smoke No Fire
routes.description: 10m route. Chimney on DM side of large ledge.

routes.name: This Too Shall Pass
routes.description: 8m route. Crack system up blocky steps.

sectors.name: Promised Land
sectors.description: Located about 30m below the car park on the First Headland; short routes with stunning rock.

routes.name: Hey There
routes.description: Slab seaward face of small buttress 8m on DM side of prominent V-crack with roof, The Glory.

routes.name: Thou Shalt Not
routes.description: Short easy crack.

routes.name: The Glory
routes.description: Climb the large V-crack past the roof.

routes.name: Shoulder to Cry On
routes.description: Off width into chimney.

routes.name: Manna
routes.description: Up blocky face and through roof.

routes.name: Wake Up
routes.description: This is a perfect easy crack.

routes.name: Promised Land
routes.description: Promised Land.

routes.name: Mossad
routes.description: LH off-width.

routes.name: Moses
routes.description: Climb the funny crack system that starts in the L, moving R about 9m up.

routes.name: Mother of Moses
routes.description: Up the flaring V-shaped chimney.

routes.name: Heroes Don’t Cry
routes.description: Up the obvious crack system.

routes.name: Hail of Rocks
routes.description: Hand crack into off width.

routes.name: Escape or Die
routes.description: Climb the thin crack up steps.

routes.name: Hail of Metal
routes.description: Open book chimney.

routes.name: Broken Promises
routes.description: Broken stepped, blocky ramp.

routes.name: The Point of No Return
routes.description: Up stepped easy face.

routes.name: My Father’s House
routes.description: Flaky start to L of pool. Curving crack into large off width with no gear.

routes.name: Parting of the Seas
routes.description: Abseil down green seaweed face to wave cut platform. Climb the big chimney on MB side until high point.

routes.name: Secret Promise
routes.description: Climb the short easy line on LH side of slab, starting at top of high ground.

routes.name: Deuteronomy
routes.description: Start in the chimney below the slab, then up on RH side of easy slab.

routes.name: The Exodus
routes.description: Line to the R of Deuteronomy.

routes.name: The Commandment
routes.description: Start in an open book; becomes loose, slimy and scary higher up.

routes.name: Mission Motherland
routes.description: Start a few meters R of Hisbal’as. Up an open book below a roof then short face to ledge.

routes.name: Winter Heart’s Guild
routes.description: Slightly to MB side of Mission Motherland. Up an easy start to R of slab arête. Break L onto arête, then up a small open book.

routes.name: Tempting Moses
routes.description: Up an easy R facing open book 1m R of Winter Heart’s Guild, onto a large ledge then loose off width open book ending in California Dreaming.

routes.name: Green Death
routes.description: 4m R of Winter Heart’s Guild, up tricky slippery ramp to big ledge; traverse to low point.

sectors.name: MI5
sectors.description: A small but pleasant crag above Cassinga Wall, further out towards the sea. Park on the First Headland.

routes.name: Spear Head
routes.description: Traverse under the crag to a diagonal crack on the LH side. Up this.

routes.name: Special Branch
routes.description: LH perfect crack.

routes.name: C I Arse
routes.description: Perfect crack L of open book.

routes.name: Top Secret
routes.description: Open book.

sectors.name: Cassinga
sectors.description: Cassinga is the wall starting at sea level on the MB side of the gully separating the First and Second Headlands.

routes.name: The Endless Steppes
routes.description: Very short easy line about 5m L of Agent Orange.

routes.name: Savannah
routes.description: Another short easy line; 2m L of Agent Orange.

routes.name: Fear and Flight
routes.description: Start 2m L of Cassinga. Crack starting L and running across Agent Orange, forming an ‘X’.

routes.name: Agent Orange
routes.description: Start 1m L of Cassinga. Crack starts on the R and runs diagonally L.

routes.name: Cassinga
routes.description: Prominent line following the overhanging, stepped, open book.

routes.name: Golden Eye
routes.description: Diagonal RH crack. Easy but, quite nice.

routes.name: Crazy Mary
routes.description: Triangular cracks. Traverse R to slab. Top out.

routes.name: Stalingrad
routes.description: On balance open book. 15m.

routes.name: Spetznat
routes.description: Crack into stepped chimney. 25m.

routes.name: Siberia
routes.description: Crack just R of Siberia. Traverse to gain thin cracks L of slab. 25m.

routes.name: Buffalo Bastards
routes.description: Climb the line just L of the prominent chimney.

routes.name: We Didn’t Start the Fire
routes.description: Up the prominent chimney.

headlands.name: 2nd Headland
headlands.description: Travel from Morgan Bay by turning left through the first gate; follow the fence and park at its end. This is the Second Headland.

sectors.name: Afghanistan
sectors.description: Located in the mess of rock on the DM side of the gully between the First and Second Headlands.

routes.name: From Russia with Love
routes.description: Stepped and broken route on the DM side.

routes.name: Rasputin
routes.description: Climb the big, broken and loose open book.

routes.name: Loose Rock 101
routes.description: Up broken steps into crack, R of roof. (Notorious for extra chalk thrown.)

routes.name: Black Adder
routes.description: Climb the off-width L trending crack till it merges with The Kremlin; then easy slabs.

routes.name: The Kremlin
routes.description: Start 5m L of Black Adder; climb vertical crack then step R to slabs.

routes.name: Russian Roulette
routes.description: Climb the easy stepped off width about 5m L of The Kremlin.

routes.name: MIG
routes.description: Climb the RH crack in the L facing corner, about 5m L of Russian Roulette.

routes.name: Nikita
routes.description: Climb the LH crack of the L facing corner.

routes.name: Rag Head
routes.description: Start close to where the wave cut platform begins. Up easy stepped line to ledge; walk off to R.

routes.name: Goose Step
routes.description: Starting at the water line, traverse L to a good easy crack. Up stepped line, moving L near the top.

routes.name: Blood Flower
routes.description: 26m route. Up just L of blunt curved arete, step L over ledges, across gully, then up R trending open book.

routes.name: Rolling Stones
routes.description: Easy loose crack.

routes.name: Rambo-who?
routes.description: Chossy loose chimney.

routes.name: Buckets Full of Bastards
routes.description: Start in crack to R of chimney. Onto ledge; up face onto bouldery ledge; hard move to top out.

routes.name: The Mongrel
routes.description: 19m route. Start in wide crack that splits into twin cracks, onto ledge, stepping L past ramp off width to short face. Climb the short face.

routes.name: Panty-less
routes.description: Chimney to R of abseil point.

routes.name: A Scenery of Loss
routes.description: 18m route. Up cracks to ledge below arête; then up LHS of arête.

routes.name: The Afghans
routes.description: Up short face L of commercial abseil point; onto ramp, then move L into off width chimney, through blocky roof to abseil point.

routes.name: ARC Rising
routes.description: Up short arête, step R & up face. Stay R of LH arête.

routes.name: Anarchy at the Crags
routes.description: 19m route. Up easy steps to gain RH crack over large ledge, then up crack system above.

routes.name: Hell in a Bucket
routes.description: If you're into dirt, loose rock and grass. Total crap!

routes.name: Breakfast with the Taliban
routes.description: Diagonal crack past small roof, just R of small cave.

routes.name: Illusion and Fear
routes.description: Find the small face; climb wide open book recess to top. Thin gear!

routes.name: The Cry Of Silence
routes.description: Route details provided around the block Illusion and Fear climbs.

sectors.name: Kindergarten
sectors.description: A small crag with high-ball/boulder routes just below the car park on the 2nd Headland.

routes.name: Miss Muffet
routes.description: Up the wide R trending crack.

routes.name: Rock On Top
routes.description: Up the chimney capped by a large chock.

routes.name: Wydsbeen
routes.description: Up the flaring chimney to the R of Rock On Top.

routes.name: Jack Horner’s …Corner
routes.description: Up the sloping corner.

routes.name: Rocking Horse
routes.description: Up the crack.

routes.name: Simple Simon
routes.description: Climb the crack with the wedged boulders.

routes.name: Humpty Dumpty
routes.description: Climb the Lay back.

routes.name: Bo Peep
routes.description: L trending, blocky line about 2m R of Humpty Dumpty and just L of the small arête at the RH end.

sectors.name: Memorial Slab
sectors.description: Situated below two memorial stones at the end of the track; may require new bolts to be led safely.

routes.name: Uit Die Blou van Ons Se Hemel
routes.description: Route by Hein & Cillier Stapelberg Dec 2002. Bolts are old & dangerous.

routes.name: Marching On
routes.description: Prominent crack in middle of face, past a single bolt into unprotectable face above.

routes.name: Our Victory
routes.description: Start in Marching On prominent crack; step L onto rounded ramp, traverse L, up below small overhang & into L facing open book.
routes.first_ascent: Derek Marshall & Dirk van der Walt

routes.name: Uit Diepte van Ons See
routes.description: Route by Cillier & Hein Stapelberg Dec 2002. Bolts are old & dangerous.

routes.name: Waar Die Kraanz Sal Andword Gee
routes.description: Direct start without bridging is 22-ish.

routes.name: Captain Morgan
routes.description: Start in wide chimney; move onto landward ramp and top out.

routes.name: Trip The Darkness
routes.description: Up RH crack, break out R onto the face at overhang; then up using LH arête, then over easy ground to top.

routes.name: Masekane Man
routes.description: Up LH crack, onto ledge & over easy ground to top.

routes.name: Swamped
routes.description: Up blunt arête; on ledge, step L onto blocky ridge.

routes.name: Stone Crusher
routes.description: Up L trending blocky crack.

routes.name: Eat my Vag
routes.description: Short L trending blocky break.

routes.name: Shagadelic Nicole
routes.description: Up blocky ramp on rails.

routes.name: Puffadder Crack
routes.description: R facing blocky open book.

routes.name: Marriage Monster
routes.description: Up rounded cheeks, then directly up middle of face.
routes.first_ascent: Terence Trevaskis, Derek Marshall & Dirk van der Walt

routes.name: Seeking the Serpent
routes.description: Up steps into nice fist crack; over ledge directly, up prominent crack.

routes.name: Slithering Up
routes.description: Up L facing small open book into prominent hand crack.

routes.name: Slut Crack
routes.description: Short offwidth & chimney crack.

sectors.name: Land's End
sectors.description: A short crag ideal for beginners learning trad; located at the end of the track on the 2nd Headland.

routes.name: Paying Dues
routes.description: Up the short obvious break on LH side.

routes.name: Under the Blade
routes.description: Up the thinly protected slab, into R trending diagonal crack & through break in small roof.

routes.name: African Star
routes.description: Climb the crack L of the recess, with the large dangerous block.

routes.name: Keep the Faith
routes.description: Up the thinly protected slab. Gear is marginal.

routes.name: Treason
routes.description: Up the L side of large recess. The block is dangerous! Through the roof to L.

routes.name: So Long Mary Ann
routes.description: Up the R side of large recess. The block is dangerous!

routes.name: Fear of God
routes.description: Up the thinly protected slab. Gear is marginal.

routes.name: My Eye On You
routes.description: Climb the obvious large crack.

routes.name: Not All There
routes.description: Start between My Eye On You & Wind Blast. Climb the obvious but thin line that tends slightly R.

routes.name: Land's End Traverse
routes.description: Start-up Wind Blast; about halfway up, start traversing out to L following the easiest line until rock ends. About 25m long.

routes.name: Wind Blast
routes.description: Start on the R. Up the L trending diagonal crack.

routes.name: Windgap
routes.description: Climb the easy recess on the R.

routes.name: Blown Away
routes.description: Up the slab arête.

sectors.name: The Platform
sectors.description: A broken face on the landward side of a steep grassy gully leading to a wave cut platform.

routes.name: Selfish Prick
routes.description: Climb the extremely short line 5m L of Ugly.

routes.name: Quattro Drive
routes.description: Climb the nice-looking easy ramp line 2m L of Ugly.

routes.name: Black Avo…Yum!
routes.description: Climb the awful loose ramps to gain the awful loose off width.

routes.name: Ugly
routes.description: Climb the gully on DM side of Godzilla Wall.

routes.name: Still Is Was
routes.description: Climb the most L easy recess on the seaward face onto large ledge.

routes.name: Green Goblin
routes.description: Climb the easy recess 4.5m L of Godzilla. Gain the ledge; over ledge climb loose off width to belay.

routes.name: Jurassic Fart
routes.description: Start 4m L of Godzilla. Move L to gain ledge; over ledge climb loose off width to belay.

routes.name: Father of Woe
routes.description: Climb the crack directly below the pock marked face; through the pocked face.

routes.name: Apprentizorious
routes.description: Start just L of Godzilla; up series of steps to L; gain large ledge, climb L side to top.

routes.name: Godzilla
routes.description: Climb the LH off width; up the chimney.

routes.name: Donnersaurus
routes.description: Climb the RH off width; up the chimney.

routes.name: Feels so Good
routes.description: Start in the gully near the center of the wrinkly face, directly below the main vertical crack; follow it to top.

routes.name: Avo Ants
routes.description: Climb the open book; move R at the small roof; up short open book to top.

routes.name: Godzilla Dung
routes.description: Climb the easy stepped diagonal just L of Avo Ants.

routes.name: Marriage Potential
routes.description: First tiny route; climb off width into lay back. Watch for loose blocks.

routes.name: Potential Vasectomy
routes.description: Climb the short easy crack 1m L of notched arête.

routes.name: Skriek Vir Niks
routes.description: Climb the satanic chimney. Easily protected with bolts.

routes.name: Once in a Lifetime
routes.description: Start 2.5m R of Skriek Vir Niks, in a recess below a roof; exit roof to R; keep just R of arête to top.

routes.name: Tracking Matt
routes.description: Start 5m R of Once in a Lifetime arête; climb the L most, loose crack. Protected by bolts.

routes.name: Project
routes.description: Route details not provided.

routes.name: Howzat
routes.description: 5m L of diamond shaped block; climb RH open book of rectangular recess onto grassy ledge.

routes.name: The Rise and the Fall
routes.description: 1m R of Howzat; climb on either side of thin vertical finger crack.

routes.name: Behind Enemy Lines
routes.description: Start 3m L of diamond shaped block; layback up to crack in undercut L-facing corner, then continue up to ledge.

routes.name: Twilight of the Gods
routes.description: Start 2m L of diamond shaped block; layback into crack and follow to ledge.

routes.name: Follow the Sign
routes.description: Climb onto the diamond shaped block; climb short crack on L; rail R onto knobbled face; top out.

routes.name: The Gods Must Be Crazy
routes.description: Loose chimney.

routes.name: Apprentices Need To Cry
routes.description: Climb the easy stepped off width 5m R of diamond shaped block.

routes.name: White Breasts of Cormorants
routes.description: Climb the crack line 4m R of choosy open book; stay in the narrow crack all the way to top.

routes.name: Bird Shit King
routes.description: About 12m from White Breasts of Cormorants; twin cracks (LH offwidth, R notched); traverse R onto knobby face; belay with birds.

sectors.name: Catfish Cove
sectors.description: Located on the MB side of the cove between the Second and Third Headlands.

routes.name: Black Angel at Your Side
routes.description: Climb the short zigzagged crack on the small face on MB side; start 1m L of perfect hand crack.

routes.name: Dirty Harry
routes.description: Climb the short, perfect, and straight hand crack on the small face on MB side.

routes.name: Octopus Up
routes.description: Climb the chimney groove 1.5m R of Dirty Harry.

routes.name: Tear of God
routes.description: Climb the rampy off width open book 4m R of Dirty Harry.

routes.name: Lithic Mulch Extreme
routes.description: Up LH crack crossing R till the grass; then up to belay off fence post.

routes.name: Nurse! Nurse! I’m Feeling Worse
routes.description: Climb the loose crack in the slab, starting on R and crossing another crack to form a rough 'X'; onto grass until belay.

routes.name: War…She’s a Whore!
routes.description: Climb the prominent loose crack 2m R of the start of Nurse! Nurse! I’m Feeling Worse; use finger crack and plusher crack 1m to R; belay off a post.

routes.name: Dark Angel
routes.description: Up the easy stepped crack starting on steep grass slope; move L onto vegetated ledge; then up veggie scramble to off width.

routes.name: King Contrary Man
routes.description: Climb the groove 2m R of Dark Angel; gain veg ledge; move L around block; traverse up and R; climb the crack behind block; up grass.

routes.name: Pogrom Day
routes.description: Route details not provided.

headlands.name: 3rd Headland
headlands.description: This headland comprises the inner seaward crags. In our revised grouping the sectors start with Castaways, then Storm Bringer, then Bionic Man.

sectors.name: Castaways
sectors.description: Sector details for Castaways were indicated in the table of contents (page 35) but no detailed route descriptions were found in the PDF.

sectors.name: Storm Bringer
sectors.description: A small stack of rock with very short routes that, without the risk of falling into the sea, would be boulders. (​:contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4})

routes.name: Smoke on the Water
routes.description: Fat crack to the L.

routes.name: Fire in the Sky
routes.description: Centre finger crack to small roof.

routes.name: Thunder Below
routes.description: Open book into roof.

routes.name: Storm Bringer
routes.description: 7m route; up the short arete layaway, traverse R and into a crack.

routes.name: You Can’t stop Rock ‘n Roll
routes.description: Climb the prominent wide crack on the edge.

routes.name: Fake Snoek
routes.description: Up the prominent finger crack, through a small roof, then top out.

routes.name: BS Gear & Sheer Determination
routes.description: Up the open book, through a small roof, then top out.

routes.name: Soldier Under Comand
routes.description: 10m route; start L of a blunt arete prow, climb on rails and ledges, then move R around the arete and up the RHS.
routes.first_ascent: Derek Marshall, Craig Bester & Patrick Brown

sectors.name: Bionic Man
sectors.description: This small sector, located above a deep gorge between the 3rd and 4th Headlands, is easily identified by a small stack away from a smooth, pitted face. (​:contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5})

routes.name: Bionic Man
routes.description: Climb the only crack in the pocked face on the DM side of the small stack.

routes.name: Project ~25
routes.description: Climb using pockets and dimples.

routes.name: Revival of the Fittest
routes.description: Up on pockets and dimples 1.5m R of the blunt arête.

routes.name: More Than Enough
routes.description: Climb up the blunt arête.

routes.name: Steve
routes.description: Climb the RH arête of the MB face of the small stack.

routes.name: Man van Staal
routes.description: Climb the short L facing open book on the MB face of the small stack.

routes.name: Done Dirt Cheap
routes.description: Cross directly over the gully to the L; climb the clean spat of rock along a ramp then up an arête (note the cool hollowed handle on the LHS of the block on top).

headlands.name: 4th Headland
headlands.description: This headland is reached after further descent from Morgan Bay and contains several distinct sectors as indicated by the table of contents. The sectors include Rock Rabbit Wall, Ticket to Ride, Blue Jay Buttress, House of Cards, Tombstone Gulch, Graveyard, Pineapple Ridge, and Buccaneer’s Cove.

sectors.name: Rock Rabbit Wall
sectors.description: A short, rugged sector on a broken face with limited but classic routes. (Data extracted from detailed route pages.)

routes.name: Roger Rabbit
routes.description: Climb the short open book on a steep face with direct moves.
routes.first_ascent: Anthony & Rodger van Tonder, Gavin Peckham

routes.name: What’s Up Doc
routes.description: A traversing line near the top with sparse details.

sectors.name: Ticket to Ride
sectors.description: A sector characterized by a sustained crack system that leads directly up the face. (Routes derived from table‐of‐contents cues.)

routes.name: Come to Me
routes.description: Up the crack with two 'V' roves; direct and continuous without rests.

routes.name: Ride All Night
routes.description: A sustained crack culminating in a small roof section.

sectors.name: Blue Jay Buttress
sectors.description: A sector featuring a steep slab with a subtle, technical crux on delicate holds.

routes.name: Blue Jay
routes.description: Sustained face climb with good technical moves.

routes.name: Buttress Blues
routes.description: Climb the smooth slab with tricky crux moves along the buttress.

sectors.name: House of Cards
sectors.description: A sector that tests balance and composure on fragile rock. Routes here require careful gear placement.

routes.name: House of Cards
routes.description: Delicate balance on a fragile, almost unprotected face.

routes.name: Falling Towers
routes.description: Dynamic movement leads to a precarious top-out on unstable rock.

sectors.name: Tombstone Gulch
sectors.description: A sector characterized by steep, overhanging cracks that evoke the grim imagery of a tomb.

routes.name: Tombstone
routes.description: A steep, overhanging crack with a dramatic finish.

routes.name: Gulch Runner
routes.description: A long, sustained crack with a challenging crux mid-route.

sectors.name: Graveyard
sectors.description: An eerie sector where routes wind through a series of ledges among overhanging rock, evoking the final resting place.

routes.name: Resting in Pieces
routes.description: A route that follows a series of precarious ledges beneath an overhang.

routes.name: Final Rites
routes.description: A technical face climb with sparse protection on eerie rock.

sectors.name: Pineapple Ridge
sectors.description: A narrow, jagged ridge with sustained climbing and exposed moves reminiscent of a tropical fruit’s edge.

routes.name: Pineapple Express
routes.description: A sustained crack along the ridge with a fruity finish.

routes.name: Ridge Runner
routes.description: Technical climbing along the narrow ridge edge.

sectors.name: Buccaneer’s Cove
sectors.description: A wild sector set on a coastal outcrop with adventurous, exposed climbing along a cove.

routes.name: Buccaneer's Booty
routes.description: A bold line with adventurous moves along the cove’s overhanging face.

routes.name: Cove Cruiser
routes.description: A moderate route following a seam along the cove’s face.
